I'm sanj Bala the head of data planning
analytics at Channel 4 channel 4 is a

Given month we reach approximately 46
million UK adults and we have a
registration base of about 9 million
registered users the more we understand
about our viewers they likes their
preferences their tastes the better
we're able to then start to commission

way in which we might start to promote
some of those shows we realized very
quickly that the sort of order of
magnitude of volume of data we were
going to be dealing with we're going to
be changing significantly so the
solution we finally decided upon was
using Amazon's elastic M reduce
technology that's powered by Intel we
have gone from taking 8 months to load
something to turn half days what this
therefore means is our analyst to get
access to data quicker we're able to
develop products faster and we're able
to then trade from an advertising
perspective a lot sooner one of the key
benefits that we've realized from the
elastic M reduced solution set is um a
big data control panel what this allows
our analysts to do it allows them to
spin up clusters that are powered by
Intel xon technology because we then had
potentially infinite processing power
without the the subsequent upfront cost
of infrastructure in tin can that's sort
of an asset that then is written off of
the books that flexibility has allowed
us to then deliver greater value into
the business in a much shorter time
frame so historically one of the
challenges from an analytics perspective
when you're dealing with huge volumes of
data is the need for sampling so
invariably the analysis will take a 1%
or a 5% sample of all viewing Behavior
the problem with sampling you often miss
the needle in the Hy in terms of the
signs and the signals around what's
happening in viewing Behavior the key
advantage that elastic M ruce gave us
was the ability for the first time for
our analyst to look at the entire data
set and be able to run analytical sort
of queries and algorithms across the
entire piece increasingly privacy laws
are moving towards viewers and consumers
having greater control and greater
transparency what's actually required is
the ability and the capabilities to run
what I call in session analy ICS so that
is for example being able to understand
a viewer interaction that's happening
live on our platform analyzing it
passing it through to an ad server and
being able to then provide a much more
relevant targeted
ad so 60 minutes we're able to
understand our viewers all the
interactions they're having on our
website and our video on demand products
analyze model and score and then deliver
a highly relevant and targeted ad before
the end of the content
